skill.name: react-observability
skill.description: Logging, error messages, and debugging patterns for React. Use when adding logging, designing error messages, debugging production issues, or improving code observability. Works for both React web and React Native.
skill.summary: React observability best practices for logging, error handling, and debugging
skill.author: CJHarmath

security_audit.summary: Educational skill providing React observability best practices. All static findings are false positives from documentation examples in markdown code blocks. No executable code or security risks detected.

content.user_title: Build Observable React Applications with Smart Logging
content.value_statement: Silent failures make debugging impossible. This skill teaches you to write React code with built-in observability through structured logging, contextual error messages, and production-ready debugging patterns.
actual_capabilities: Generate structured logging patterns with contextual information for React applications
Design error messages that include diagnostic context and actionable information
Implement flow tracing for multi-step operations with unique identifiers
Create sensitive data redaction utilities to prevent credential leakage in logs
Build error boundaries with comprehensive error reporting and fallback UI
Add state snapshot debugging helpers for complex async flows
limitations: Does not execute or test code, only generates patterns and examples
Logging patterns require integration with your existing logging infrastructure
Error reporting examples assume Sentry but may need adaptation for other services
Does not provide production monitoring dashboard configuration

use_cases.title: Debug Production Issues Without Source Maps
use_cases.description: Add comprehensive logging to React components so production errors include enough context to diagnose issues from logs alone, even when source maps are unavailable.

use_cases.title: Implement Observability in New React Features
use_cases.description: Design new features with observability from the start by adding structured logging, error boundaries, and flow tracing to complex user workflows.
use_cases.target_user: React developers building new application features

use_cases.title: Audit Existing Code for Silent Failures
use_cases.description: Review existing React components to identify and fix silent early returns, missing error context, and unhandled promise rejections that make debugging difficult.

prompt_templates.title: Add Logging to Component
prompt_templates.prompt: Add structured logging to this React component with proper error context and state snapshots
prompt_templates.scenario: You have a component with complex logic that needs observability

prompt_templates.title: Design Error Message
prompt_templates.prompt: Improve this error message to include diagnostic context, relevant state, and a hypothesis about the cause
prompt_templates.scenario: An error message lacks information needed for debugging

prompt_templates.title: Implement Flow Tracing
prompt_templates.prompt: Add flow tracing with unique identifiers to this multi-step async operation so I can track execution in logs
prompt_templates.scenario: A checkout or form submission flow needs better observability

prompt_templates.title: Build Secure Logger with Redaction
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a logging utility that automatically redacts sensitive fields like passwords, tokens, and API keys from log output
prompt_templates.scenario: Need to prevent credential leakage in production logs

output_examples.input: Add logging to track why users are hitting the 'item not found' error in the cart
output_examples.output: The skill provides a logger wrapper that logs when cart items are missing, including the item ID, current cart state, last sync time, and a hypothesis that the cache may be stale. This gives developers enough context to diagnose the issue from production logs.

output_examples.input: Help me debug this checkout flow that sometimes fails silently
output_examples.output: The skill generates a flow tracing pattern with a unique checkout ID, logging each step of validation, payment processing, and order confirmation with timestamps and state snapshots, making it easy to identify where the flow stops in production.

output_examples.input: Create an error boundary that captures component crashes with full context
output_examples.output: The skill provides an ErrorBoundary component that catches rendering errors, logs the error message, stack trace, and component stack, reports to error monitoring services, and displays a fallback UI to prevent full app crashes.

best_practices: Log every early return with enough context to understand why the code path was taken and what state led to it
Include a hypothesis in error messages about what might have caused the failure to speed up debugging
Use unique flow identifiers for multi-step operations so you can trace entire workflows in log aggregation tools
anti_patterns: Logging sensitive data like passwords, tokens, or API keys without redaction can expose credentials in log files
Generic error messages without context force developers to add logging and redeploy to diagnose production issues
Silent catches that swallow errors without logging make it impossible to know when failures occur in production

faq.question: Does this skill work with React Native?
faq.answer: Yes, all patterns work with both React web and React Native. The logging utilities use standard console methods that work in both environments.

faq.question: How do I integrate with my existing logging service?
faq.answer: The skill provides logger wrapper patterns that you can customize to send logs to your service. Replace the console calls with your logging SDK calls.

faq.question: Will adding all this logging slow down my app?
faq.answer: The skill includes log level filtering so you can control verbosity. Debug logs can be disabled in production while keeping errors and warnings active.

faq.question: Can I use this with TypeScript?
faq.answer: Yes, all examples are written in TypeScript with proper type annotations and type assertions for safer error handling.

faq.question: How do I prevent logging sensitive user data?
faq.answer: The skill includes a redaction utility that automatically strips sensitive fields from log context objects before they are written to logs or sent to monitoring services.

faq.question: What if I need to debug in production right now?
faq.answer: The skill includes a quick debugging template you can add temporarily to dump state at key points, then remove or gate behind a feature flag once the issue is resolved.
